za.ac.salt.pipt.common
Class ErrorLog

java.lang.Object
  za.ac.salt.pipt.common.ErrorLog

public class ErrorLog
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a simple error log shared by all PIPT tools. It allows to show error messages in an own frame. To this end, various convenience methods are provided.

ErrorLog

Method Detail

getLocation

public static java.awt.Point getLocation(javax.swing.JComponent parent)
Returns the location of the origin (i.e. the upper left corner) of the error log frame. If possible this location is chosen so that the centers of the error log frame and the given parent component coincide. However, it is ensured that the entire frame is visible on the screen.

Parameters:
parent - the parent component
Returns:
the location of the error log frame origin on the screen

repaint

public static void repaint(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                           java.lang.String errorMessage)
Repaints the error log frame with the given error message

Parameters:
parent - the parent component used for positioning the error log frame
errorMessage - the error message

invalidValueMessage

public static void invalidValueMessage(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                                       java.lang.Object invalidValue)
Displays the (not particularly informative) message that the given value isn't valid.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
invalidValue - the value which isn't valid

noNumberMessage

public static void noNumberMessage(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                                   java.lang.Object noNumberValue)
Displays a message which informs the user that the given value (the string representation of which is shown) doesn't constitute a number.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
noNumberValue - the value which is no number

rejectedValueMessage

public static void rejectedValueMessage(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                                        java.lang.Object rejectedValue,
                                        InvalidValueException invalidValueException)
Displays a message which informs the user that the given value has been rejected. Both the string representation of the rejected value and the reason why it is invalid are given. The latter is taken from the supplied InvalidValueException.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
rejectedValue - the rejected value
invalidValueException - the InvalidValueException because of which the values has been rejected

indexOutOfRangeMessage

public static void indexOutOfRangeMessage(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                                          int index,
                                          int minimumValue,
                                          int maximumValue)
Displays a message which informs the user that the given index value lies outside the given allowed range.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
index - the forbidden index value
minimumValue - the minimum allowed value
maximumValue - the maximum allowed value

fileNotSavedMessage

public static void fileNotSavedMessage(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                                       java.io.File file,
                                       java.io.IOException ioe)
Displays a message which informs the user that the given file couldn't be saved, including the respective message of the given IOException.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
file - the file which couldn't be saved
ioe - the IOException thrown during the attempt to save the file

                                                   javax.xml.bind.JAXBException je)
Displays a message informing the user that the given file contains invalid XML content, giving the respective error message as well.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
je - the JAXBException thrown during the validation

validationFailedMessage

public static void validationFailedMessage(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                                           org.xml.sax.SAXException se)
Displays a message informing the user that the validation of some XML content failed, giving the respective error message as well.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
se - the SAXException containing the reason why the validation failed

generalErrorMessage

                                       java.lang.String errorMessage)
Displays a message with the given error message.

Parameters:
parent - the component that is used for positioning the error log frame (may be null)
errorMessage - the error message to be displayed
